intro: Satureja glabella, commonly known as golden sage, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Satureja glabella is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its aromatic and potentially therapeutic properties.
